title: Authors and Citation
text: Pete Winskill. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Winskill P (2024). treasure: Malaria unit costing. R package version 1.1.1.
code: @Manual{,   title = {treasure: Malaria unit costing},   author = {Pete Winskill},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.1.1}, }

title: Malaria unit costing
text: goal treasure provide basic, generic unit-costing help malariasimulation. Functionality minimal. key goal treasure transparent version controlled repository unit cost estimates included detailed citations references cost sources. ⚠️ Cost estimates targeted --date possible. Retrospective costing past programmes may therefore require adjustment. ⚠️ living package costs updated new data available. , sure reference use specific version stable costing required project. ⚠️ exhaustive source malaria programme costs. example complete costing exercise please see Patouillard et al, recent cost cost-effectiveness review Conteh et al. ⚠️ using treasure, please sure reference original sources, just package. ⚠️ costs USD$, however reference year costs may differ costs inflation-adjusted.

title: Malaria unit costing
text: Updates, reviews improvements encouraged via PRs! Updates citable published source. -line aim package source generic costing estimates therefore broadly representative costing given intervention, (ideally) focussed specific location implementation approach. suggested update via PR include: 1. update costing function default value. 2. Updated documentation function including citable source references section. 3. Corresponding update unit tests modified costing function.

title: Malaria unit costing
text: can install development version treasure GitHub :

title: Cost Artemether/Lumefantrine treatment — cost_al
text: Note cost per dose single dose (20/120 mg). treatment course typically constitutes Artemether + lumefantrine given twice day 3 days following weight-based guidelines: 5 <15 kg: 20/120 mg 15 <25 kg: 40/240 mg 35 <35 kg: 60/360 mg >= 35 kg: 80/480 mg course single adult (weighing >=35kg) may constitute 3 days x 2 times daily x 4 doses (4 x 20/120mg = 80/480mg) = 24 doses.

title: Cost Artemether/Lumefantrine treatment — cost_al
text: n_doses Number tests cost_per_dose Cost per dose single dose (20/120 mg)

title: Cost IPTp — cost_iptp
text: Dosing information Starting early possible second trimester, IPTp-SP recommended pregnant women scheduled antenatal care (ANC) visit time delivery, provided doses given least one month apart. IPTp-SP ideally administered directly observed therapy (DOT) three tablets sulfadoxine/pyrimethamine (tablet containing500 mg/25 mg SP) giving total required dosage 1500 mg/75 mg SP. https://www..int/publications-detail-redirect/-HTM-GMP-2014.4 IPTp_cost_per_dose_delivered Current default total cost per administration IPTp-SP (health care worker time commodity cost) sulfadoxine–pyrimethamine. Costs 2012 USD$. Fernandes et al (2016). Table 2. https://malariajournal.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s12936-016-1539-4

title: Cost PMC — cost_pmc
text: PMC_cost_per_dose_delivered Current default average economic cost administering 3 rounds PMC   (annually), sulfadoxine–pyrimethamine Tanzania, Ghana, Mozambique Gabon.    cost per dose delivered average cost trial results    three PMC cycles divided number cycles (0.39 / 3). Costs    2007 USD$. Cost inclfated adjust roughly 3 fold    increase SP costs (GF price reference data) Conteh et al (2010) table S4 https://journals.plos.org/plosone/article?id=10.1371/journal.pone.0010313.

title: Cost primaquine treatment — cost_primaquine
text: Note cost per dose single dose (7.5 mg). treatment course typically constitutes primaquine 0.25 mg base/kg bw per day 14 days#' course single adult (weighing 50kg) may constitute 14 days x 0.25mg x 50kg (14 x 0.25 x 50 / 7.5) = 25 doses.

title: Cost SMC — cost_smc
text: smc_cost_per_dose_delivered Current default average economic cost administering four monthly   SMC cycles sulfadoxine–pyrimethamine plus amodiaquine children   younger 5 years across seven countries Sahel subregion   (Burkina Faso, Chad, Guinea, Mali, Niger, Nigeria, Gambia)   2016. include multiple delivery methods (door door, fixed point,    mobile point, mixed). cost per dose delivered average cost    four monthly SMC cycles divided number cycles (3.63 / 4). Costs    2016 USD$. Gilmartin et al (2021) https://www.thelancet.com/journals/langlo/article/PIIS2214-109X(20)30475-7/fulltext.
